rev.comment: /* Google Lunar X Prize */ Minor reword
rev.diff:
Line 157: Line 157:
==Awards & Prizes==
==Awards & Prizes==
===Google Lunar X Prize===
===Google Lunar X Prize===
â
Google and co-sponsor, the [[X Prize Foundation]], have offered a prize of $20 million and $5 million to the first and second organisations to successfully fund and carry out a mission to place a craft on the moon (additionally, this craft should roam for a further minimum of 50 metres, transmitting a specified set of data, including images, back to Earth). A further $5 million will be distributed amongst the other contestants.
+
Google, in conjunction with, the [[X Prize Foundation]], have offered a prize of $20 million and $5 million to the first and second organisations to successfully fund and carry out a mission to place a craft on the moon (additionally, this craft should roam for a further minimum of 50 metres, transmitting a specified set of data, including images, back to Earth). A further $5 million will be distributed amongst the other contestants.
Google co-founder Sergey Brin came up with the idea for the contest after chatting with X Prize Foundation Chief Executive Peter Diamandis and PayPal founder Elon Musk. "It occurred to me that [Google] should be doing new kinds of things in ambitious and unexpected ways," Brin said in a statement to the Press.
Google co-founder Sergey Brin came up with the idea for the contest after chatting with X Prize Foundation Chief Executive Peter Diamandis and PayPal founder Elon Musk. "It occurred to me that [Google] should be doing new kinds of things in ambitious and unexpected ways," Brin said in a statement to the Press.
